column4: well to be honest I haven't had any problems with it yet, but I don't use a printer, and I haven't really bothered with the gnome config tools
wait thats not true I had problems installing it
wouldn't detect my hard drive, had to install windows on it first and then it would
it wasn't only ubuntu though, my debian install cd wouldn't detect my hd
why are you using ubuntu in the first place?
or just use a different distro like say debian
I am only using ubuntu over debian because I am lazy and didn't want to bother with my video card, I read that 7.10 would install it easy
because I like the distro? do I need to change dist because there is a bug there?
well yes if you complain about a bug and it really makes you mad it is a good reason to switch

why don't you buy a new house or a new car because there is one single, small fail on it...? or take your own life because there is something you don't like in it? these questions are as dumb as yours
if there is a small flaw of course, but then I wouldn't be complaining about it, I would ignore it or fix it
how about that there is no easy way to fix it? and if you find a way i'll shut up
if it is a small problem then it shouldn't matter
and I don't know what your problems are
it is a small, BUT annoying problem. and everytime I ask here noone can anything about it
well you could file a bug report, I didn't see any for it matching yours, but I could of looked at the wrong package
